attributes.title: Inside Einstein's Mind
attributes.description_short: Retrace the thought experiments that inspired his theory on the nature of reality.
attributes.description_long: On November 25th, 1915, Einstein published his greatest work: general relativity. The theory transformed our understanding of nature’s laws and the entire history of the cosmos, reaching back to the origin of time itself. NOVA tells the inside story of Einstein’s masterpiece. The story begins with the intuitive thought experiments that set Einstein off on his quest.

attributes.title: Making North America: Human
attributes.description_short: How has the land shaped our lives, from the arrival of the first Americans to today?
attributes.description_long: Explore the intimate connections between the landscape, the colonizing of the continent, and the emergence of our industrial world. Beginning with Native American ancestors who crafted hunting weapons from stone traded across hundreds of miles, the program shows how pre-Columbian civilizations developed an expert knowledge of the landscape and its resources.

attributes.title: Making North America: Life
attributes.description_short: How did massive volcanic eruptions, inland seas, and land bridges pave the way for life?
attributes.description_long: How did life emerge on our primeval continent? Why was North America home to so many iconic dinosaurs like T. rex? And how did a huge sea filled with giant marine reptiles end up covering Kansas? We tell the surprising intertwined story of life and the landscape in North America.

attributes.title: Making North America: Origins
attributes.description_short: Experience the colossal geologic forces that shaped our continent over 3 billion years.
attributes.description_long: The epic 3 billion-year story of how our continent came to be. From the palm trees that once flourished in Alaska to titanic eruptions that nearly tore the Midwest in two, discover how forces of almost unimaginable power gave birth to North America.

attributes.title: CyberWar Threat
attributes.description_short: As internet connections multiply so do points of attack and risks to national security.
attributes.description_long: (This program is no longer available for online streaming.) The global cyberwar is heating up and the stakes are no longer limited to the virtual world of computers. Now, thanks in part to secret documents released by Edward Snowden, the true scale of the National Security Agency's scope and power is coming to light.

attributes.title: Arctic Ghost Ship
attributes.description_short: An astonishing find could solve the mystery of Sir John Franklin’s lost expedition.
attributes.description_long: NOVA presents an exclusive breakthrough in the greatest unsolved mystery in Arctic exploration. In 1845, British explorer Sir John Franklin set off to chart the elusive Northwest Passage, commanding 128 men in two robust and well-stocked Royal Navy ships, the Erebus and Terror. They were never heard from again.

attributes.title: Dawn of Humanity
attributes.description_short: Deep in a South African cave, an astounding discovery reveals clues to what made us human.
attributes.description_long: NOVA and National Geographic present exclusive access to a unique discovery of ancient remains. Located in an almost inaccessible chamber deep in a South African cave, the site required recruiting a special team of experts slender enough to wriggle down a vertical, pitch-dark, seven-inch-wide passage. Most fossil discoveries of human relatives consist of just a handful of bones.

attributes.title: Nuclear Meltdown Disaster
attributes.description_short: Go inside the Fukushima power plants for the minute-by-minute story of what went wrong.
attributes.description_long: Go inside the Fukushima power plants for the minute-by-minute story of what went wrong.

attributes.title: Chasing Pluto
attributes.description_short: Watch as the New Horizons spacecraft captures our first clear view of Pluto’s icy surface.
attributes.description_long: Watch as the New Horizons spacecraft captures our first clear view of Pluto’s icy surface.

attributes.title: Secrets of Noah's Ark
attributes.description_short: A team attempts to build the flood boat using inscriptions from an ancient clay tablet.
attributes.description_long: In 1948, a British pilot serving in Iraq acquired a clay tablet with an intriguing, 3,700 year-old inscription. The ancient writing tells the story of how the god Enki warns a Sumerian king named Atra-Hasis of a future flood that will destroy mankind; Enki gives him instructions for building a boat to save his family and livestock.

attributes.title: Lethal Seas
attributes.description_short: A unique coral garden in Papua New Guinea shows what the future may hold.
attributes.description_long: A deadly recipe is brewing that threatens the survival of countless creatures throughout Earth’s oceans. For years, we’ve known that the oceans absorb about a quarter of the carbon dioxide in our atmosphere. But with high carbon emissions worldwide, this silent killer is entering our seas at a staggering rate, raising the ocean’s acidity.

attributes.title: Nazi Attack on America
attributes.description_short: A sunken German U-boat off the coast of New Orleans tells the story of Operation Drumbeat.
attributes.description_long: Long before 9/11, a far deadlier, little-known attack from the ocean depths struck our shores, lasting three-and-a-half years and claiming 5,000 lives. Now, famed undersea explorer Bob Ballard, discoverer of the Titanic, investigates the wreck of one of the attack craft, a German submarine that lies at the bottom of the gulf just a few miles off New Orleans.

attributes.title: The Great Math Mystery
attributes.description_short: Is math invented by humans, or is it the language of the universe?
attributes.description_long: Join NOVA on a mathematical mystery tour—a provocative exploration of math's astonishing power across the centuries. We discover math's signature in the swirl of a nautilus shell, the whirlpool of a galaxy, and the spiral in the center of a sunflower. It all leads to the ultimate riddle: Is math a human invention or the discovery of the language of the universe?

attributes.title: Colosseum: Roman Death Trap
attributes.description_short: 1500 years ago, how did the Romans engineer bloody spectacles and reenact sea battles?
attributes.description_long: 1500 years ago, how did the Romans engineer bloody spectacles and reenact sea battles?

attributes.title: Petra: Lost City of Stone
attributes.description_short: How did early engineers carve tombs into rock cliffs and funnel water to this desert city?
attributes.description_long: How did early engineers carve tombs into rock cliffs and funnel water to this desert city?

attributes.title: Hagia Sophia: Istanbul's Ancient Mystery
attributes.description_short: How has this unique structure, built on a seismic fault, survived centuries of quakes?
attributes.description_long: How has this unique structure, built on a seismic fault, survived centuries of quakes?

attributes.title: Sinkholes—Buried Alive
attributes.description_short: The catastrophic collapse of the ground beneath our feet is a growing worldwide hazard.
attributes.description_long: The catastrophic collapse of the ground beneath our feet is a growing worldwide hazard.

attributes.title: Sunken Ship Rescue
attributes.description_short: A team of 500 engineers and divers struggle to raise the Costa Concordia cruise ship.
attributes.description_long: Follow the epic operation to secure, raise, and salvage the Costa Concordia cruise ship, which ran aground and tragically capsized off the coast of Italy on January 13, 2012, killing 32 people. The massive wreck—with a 160-foot-long hole in its hull—stretches the length of three football fields, weighs 45,000 tons, and was half submerged on the site of a protected reef.

attributes.title: Big Bang Machine
attributes.description_short: Explore the deepest mysteries of the early universe and the quest to find the Higgs Boson.
attributes.description_long: Explore the deepest mysteries of the early universe and the quest to find the Higgs Boson.
